channel.title: Compiler issue
channel.description:
Hmm im having a problem with the compiler, i keep getting
javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options You have compiled the Server. Press any key to continue . . .
Im positive i set my Classpaths, i checked and javac.exe is in the folder. I've tried two different compilers and they both dont work,
@echo off title Compiler "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.7.0/bin/javac.exe" *.java @echo You have compiled the Server. pause
Thats my compiler code, and i made sure its the right directory.. can someone help me? Im pretty sure its not the paths though. Im using Azure source, which might be why it doesnt work. There is a guide someone made for how to use compiler and run for the source but the guide didnt work for me.

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @dention1 dention1
item.description:
@dention1 wrote:

So… what should i do to fix it?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Oh my Go… There’s no Java FILES in the folder you are trying to compile.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @dention1 dention1
item.description:
@dention1 wrote:

Hmm im having a problem with the compiler, i keep getting

javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
You have compiled the Server.
Press any key to continue . . .

Im positive i set my Classpaths, i checked and javac.exe is in the folder. I’ve tried two different compilers and they both dont work,

@echo off
title Compiler
“C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.7.0/bin/javac.exe” *.java
@echo You have compiled the Server.
pause

Thats my compiler code, and i made sure its the right directory… can someone help me? Im pretty sure its not the paths though.
Im using Azure source, which might be why it doesnt work. There is a guide someone made for how to use compiler and run for the source but the guide didnt work for me.

Read full topic
